edu.mines.jtk.sgl

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.sgl.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AxisAlignedPanel, Group

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A node in the scene graph.

    A node has zero or more parents. Because the number of parents can be greater than one, the scene graph forms a directed acyclic graph (DAG). However, the DAG has a single root node, called a World. A node can be moved from one world to another, but cannot exist in more than one world at a time.

    A world maintains a selected set of nodes within it. Only nodes that implement the marker interface Selectable can be selected. For convenience, the methods of that interface are implemented in this abstract base class. Classes that extend this abstract base class may override the method selectedChanged(), typically to modify the appearance of selected nodes.

    Nodes are drawn in what is called the draw process. The draw process is applied to a node in three steps by calling the methods drawBegin(DrawContext), draw(DrawContext), and drawEnd(DrawContext), in that order. The actual drawing occurs in the method draw(DrawContext). Think of the other two methods as like opening and closing braces. They might save and restore OpenGL state, or otherwise push and pop state required for drawing. Nodes must not leak OpenGL state set while drawing.

    To facilitate drawing and picking, all nodes have a bounding sphere. Ideally, this bounding sphere is the smallest sphere that contains the node's geometry. Nodes with bounding spheres that do not intersect a view's frustum will be culled, and not drawn or picked within that view. Bounding spheres are specified in local coordinates.

        public Node()

    • Method Detail

      • isSelected

        public final boolean isSelected()
        Determines whether this node is currently selected. Only nodes that implement the marker interface Selectable can be selected.
        Returns:
        true, if selected; false, otherwise.

      • setSelected

        public final void setSelected(boolean selected)
        Sets the selected state for this node. Only nodes that implement the marker interface Selectable can be selected. This method does nothing if this node is not selectable.

        Classes that extend this abstract base class may override the method selectedChanged(), typically to alter the appearance of a node that has been selected or deselected.

        Parameters:
        selected - true, for selected; false, otherwise.

      • countParents

        public int countParents()
        Returns the number of parents of this node.
        Returns:
        the number of parents.

      • getParents

        public java.util.Iterator<Group> getParents()
        Gets an iterator for the parents of this node.
        Returns:
        the iterator.

      • getWorld

        public World getWorld()
        Gets the world for this node.
        Returns:
        the world; null, if this node is not currently in a world.

      • dirtyDraw

        public void dirtyDraw()
        Marks dirty the drawing of this node. Calling this method causes a repaint of all view canvases in which this node may be rendered.

      • getBoundingSphere

        public BoundingSphere getBoundingSphere(boolean finite)
        Gets the bounding sphere for this node. If a finite bounding sphere is specified, then any infinite bounding sphere is replaced by an empty bounding sphere, so that the returned sphere is always finite.
        Parameters:
        finite - true, to force bounding sphere to be finite.
        Returns:
        the bounding sphere.

      • dirtyBoundingSphere

        public void dirtyBoundingSphere()
        Marks dirty the bounding sphere of this node (and any parent nodes). If dirty when the method getBoundingSphere(boolean) is next called, this node's bounding sphere will be recomputed.

      • getStates

        public StateSet getStates()
        Gets the OpenGL states for this node.
        Returns:
        the OpenGL states.

      • setStates

        public void setStates(StateSet states)
        Sets the OpenGL states for this node.
        Parameters:
        states - the OpenGL states.

      • pick

        public void pick(PickContext pc)
        Picks this node. This implementation does nothing. Implementations of this method in classes that extend this class may test the pick segment for intersection with node geometry. If an intersection is found, then a pick result should be added to the context.
        Parameters:
        pc - the pick context.

      • selectedChanged

        protected void selectedChanged()
        This method is called when the selected state of this node has changed. Classes that extend this abstract base class typically override this method to alter this node's appearance when selected or deselected.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • computeBoundingSphere

        protected BoundingSphere computeBoundingSphere(boolean finite)
        Computes the bounding sphere for this node, including its children. This method is called by getBoundingSphere(boolean) when this node's bounding sphere is dirty.

        If a finite bounding sphere is specified, then any infinite bounding sphere is replaced by an empty bounding sphere, so that the returned sphere is always finite.

        Classes that extend this abstract base class should override this implementation, which simply returns an empty or infinite bounding sphere, depending on whether or not a finite sphere is requested.

        Parameters:
        finite - true, to force bounding sphere to be finite.
        Returns:
        the computed bounding sphere.

      • getAttributeBits

        protected int getAttributeBits()
        Gets the OpenGL attribute bits for this node. These bits determine which OpenGL state attributes are pushed and popped in the methods drawBegin(DrawContext) and drawEnd(DrawContext).

        The attribute bits returned by this method need not include any bits from this node's StateSet, if it has one. Those bits will be combined with any bits returned by this method.

        Classes that extend this base class may override this method to return only those bits corresponding to OpenGL state that they modify but do not restore. However, classes that do so should take care to include all relevant bits. Nodes must not leak OpenGL state!

        This implementation simply returns GL_ALL_ATTRIB_BITS, which is safe, but may be inefficient.

        Returns:
        the attribute bits.

      • cullApply

        protected void cullApply(CullContext cc)
        Applies the cull process to this node. If the view frustum intersects the bounding sphere of this node, then this method calls the three methods cullBegin(CullContext), cull(CullContext), and cullEnd(CullContext), in that order.
        Parameters:
        cc - the cull context.

      • cullBegin

        protected void cullBegin(CullContext cc)
        Begins the cull process for this node. This implementation pushes this node onto the cull context,
        Parameters:
        cc - the cull context.

      • cull

        protected void cull(CullContext cc)
        Culls this node. This implementation appends the node stack to the draw list in the cull context.
        Parameters:
        cc - the cull context.

      • cullEnd

        protected void cullEnd(CullContext cc)
        Ends the cull process for this node.
        Parameters:
        cc - the cull context.

      • drawApply

        protected void drawApply(DrawContext dc)
        Applies the draw process to this node. Calls the three methods drawBegin(DrawContext), draw(DrawContext), and drawEnd(DrawContext), in that order.
        Parameters:
        dc - the draw context.

      • drawBegin

        protected void drawBegin(DrawContext dc)
        Begins the draw process for this node. This implementation pushes this node onto the draw context, and then pushes (saves) all OpenGL attributes.
        Parameters:
        dc - the draw context.

      • draw

        protected void draw(DrawContext dc)
        Draws this node. This implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dc - the draw context.

      • drawEnd

        protected void drawEnd(DrawContext dc)
        Ends the draw process for this node. This implementation pops (restores) any OpenGL attributes that were pushed (saved) and then pops this node from the draw context.
        Parameters:
        dc - the draw context.

      • pickApply

        protected void pickApply(PickContext pc)
        Applies the pick process to this node. If the pick segment intersects the bounding sphere of this node, then this method calls the three methods pickBegin(PickContext), pick(PickContext), and pickEnd(PickContext), in that order.
        Parameters:
        pc - the pick context.

      • pickBegin

        protected void pickBegin(PickContext pc)
        Begins the pick process for this node. This implementation pushes this node onto the pick context,
        Parameters:
        pc - the pick context.

      • pickEnd

        protected void pickEnd(PickContext pc)
        Ends the pick process for this node.
        Parameters:
        pc - the pick context.
